caption.title: Strengths and limitations of this study

list-item.p: This study consists of an explicit assessment of herd immunity using multitudes of data sets, including seroepidemiological survey data.
It contains an analysis of epidemiological data over a long time period, which enables us to capture the elevated age at rubella infection and identify susceptible pockets of the population.
It uses epidemiological metrics that measure the standardised seronegative proportion of the entire population as well as among pregnant women.
Only a retrospective analysis was conducted, and an optimal vaccination policy has yet to be explored.
